title: Still getting error 3334 on 18th 2012 RDP Connection
author: akincer
body_snippet:
Issue:  Receive the below "WarningMsg" on the 18th open RDP connection to 2012 servers.

RDP disconnected!
3334 Because of a protocol error, this session will be disconnected. Please try connecting to the remote computer again.

OS: Windows 7 64 bit
mRemoteNG version: 1.75.7011.34963

iterations.description: Recent comments suggest the problem was resolved in 1.77.3-NB and there is no current reproducible report on the latest build.

comments.author: Greenice33
comments.snippet: I have the same problem that can help? I want to open 30 connections

comments.author: shaded0
comments.snippet: I think this might be an issue with the install. I updated to the latest and it resolved this error for me.

comments.author: pavkamlc
comments.snippet:
Problem still occurs in version 1.76.20
It occurs when I open about 10connections. This works. But then when I reboot some from this, tab was closed and after reboot I cannot reconnect back by mremoteng, but msrdc works like a charm. Temporary solution is close mremoteng and start again from scratch.

comments.author: simonai1254
comments.snippet:
As stated in #864 the RDP error 3334 is caused by the lack of memory available to the application connecting to the servers. The reason why you can't reconnect is, that the other connections allocated more memory during runtime, reducing the remaining memory below the required minimum for a new connection. 

(See also https://github.com/mRemoteNG/mRemoteNG/issues/2090#issuecomment-1076084444)

To work around this you may want try the 64-bit Version (released with 1.77.2-NB and newer)

comments.author: pavkamlc
comments.snippet: Perfect. I try 1.77.3-NB and seems to be solved. Thanx.

comments.author: robertpopa22
comments.snippet: Triage refresh (P2): this issue has been inactive for a long time. Please retest on the latest build and share reproducible steps, expected vs actual behavior, and logs/screenshots. If there is no confirmation/update, maintainers can close it as stale or not reproducible.

notes:
AI triage (codex): Recent comments suggest the problem was resolved in 1.77.3-NB and there is no current reproducible report on the latest build.
Approach: Ask the reporter to retest on the newest build with exact steps and logs, then close as stale or mark duplicate of #864 if it cannot be reproduced.
